Multiple social media users posted image: 000 currency notes seized by the police, supporting the claim.
A tweet by: HabibHasan_ on Twitter, which has been retweeted over 400 times, specifically mentioned that the cash was recovered from the car of Ketan Dave, an RSS worker.
An India TV broadcast reported the seizu: 5 crores worth of fake Rs 2000 notes in Gujarat, which was shared by the Facebook page 'बीआरसीएस ईनटरनेशनल (BRCS International)' with the same message. However, the channel did not mention Ketan Dave's alleged association with RSS.
Alt News performed a Google reverse imag: which mentioned the seizure of 350 bundles of fake Rs 2000 currency notes from Khammam and identified Shaik Madar as the main accused. This provides a similar context to the claim.
